means: 提出( introduce的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He introduced radio to the school to increase the children's awareness.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在学校开通广播，以提高孩子们的警觉性。

sentence.Network_en: In 1971, the 1p and 2p decimal coins were introduced in Britain.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国于1971年开始使用十进制的1便士和2便士硬币。

sentence.Network_en: The British government introduced a watered-down version of the proposals.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国政府针对这些提议提出了另一较缓和的版本。

entry.def: To introduce something means to cause it to enter a place or exist in a system for the first time.

example.ex: The Government has introduced a number of other money-saving moves...
example.tran: 政府已经采取了其他一些省钱的举措。

example.ex: I kept the birds indoors all winter and introduced them into an aviary the following June...
example.tran: 整个冬天我把鸟关在室内,然后在接下来的6月份把它们放入鸟类饲养场饲养。

entry.tran: 介绍;使了解;使初次接触
entry.def: If you introduce someone to something, you cause them to learn about it or experience it for the first time.

example.ex: He introduced us to the delights of natural food.
example.tran: 他让我们认识到食用天然食物的乐趣。

entry.def: If you introduce one person to another, or you introduce two people, you tell them each other's names, so that they can get to know each other. If you introduce yourself to someone, you tell them your name.

example.ex: Tim, may I introduce you to my uncle's secretary, Mary Waller?...
example.tran: 蒂姆,我来介绍一下，这位是我叔叔的秘书玛丽·沃勒。

example.ex: Someone introduced us and I sat next to him...
example.tran: 有人给我们作了介绍,我挨着他坐下了。

entry.tran: 为(电视或广播节目)做开场白;主持
entry.def: The person who introduces a television or radio programme speaks at the beginning of it, and often between the different items in it, in order to explain what the programme or the items are about.

example.ex: 'Health Matters' is introduced by Dick Oliver on BBC World Service.
example.tran: 英国广播公司对外广播频道的“健康动态”节目由迪克·奥利弗主持。

Sentence.sentence: What it does mean is that the book business will go through a transformation in the next decade or so more profound than any it has seen since Gutenberg introduced printing from moveable type in the 1450s.
Albert Einstein predicted this in 1905, when he introduced the concept of relative time as part of his Special Theory of Relativity.
